title: I figured out why Janna's Splash Art makes me blue...
body:
It literally has too much blue value. Despite changes to her character, the picture itself seemed off for some reason. The amount of blue in the picture makes her seem cold at best, but nearly corpse like at worse, resulting in the uncanny valley effect. Just giving the picture some warmth makes it far more palatable.

I would like to see some of the other issues fixed, like her tattoo brought back, neckline fixed, and more expression in her face, but just fixing the amount of blue softens up her facial features, and the entire picture, tremendously.

You put so much thought into the lore that you have (of course) picked out the portions of her story that supports your ideas.

The final line of her lore is:

"Do not be captivated by Janna's beauty. Like the wind, she is one gust away from terrible destruction."

This basically epitomizes the splash as it is now. And the warmer, fuzzier version isn't really representative of how they envisioned her. Just because she's the center of attention doesn't means she's not a menacing champion on the rift (she is). And simply because she has one soothing line in her VO doesn't reverse this fact, either.

So rather than pointing out only the things that support your argument, I'd look at the bigger picture and see where they got the inspiration for the current splash and why they'd prefer not to use the warmer version.

You are being a bit selective with your information yourself. Yes, Janna is "one gust away from terrible destruction", but the heed is "Do not be captivated by Janna's beauty." Just because she is beautiful, does not mean she is not powerful. Her kindness and seeking harmony is not weakness.

She is not meant to be the White Witch; she is a good character(generally considered in the Neutral Good alignment of D&D). She is social, gracious, and amiable, but quite powerful. Thats what makes her so iconic. At the same time, if you cross her, you will regret it, as she is no push over, but that does not mean she is cold or harsh. She is just a very passionate individual.

They used the more blue one in part because of her location and in part because of her staff. That's Riot's artist's reasoning. I don't see how the final line in her lore does anything less to prove my point though? It mentions Janna's beauty and how it captivates people. If you're captivated by someone's beauty like that you're often putting them up on some sort of heavenly pedestal (that they probably don't belong on). "As you wish" "with ease" "for tranquility" "by your command" "In harmony" "breathlessly" that's *1/2 of her quotes* and they aren't menacing. Yes she does have a few 'threatening' VO lines and yes on the rift she's very scary (I'm a Janna main I don't doubt she's scary) but she's also a support. She's not an offensive support (although she can be used in that manner) she is the poster child for the defensive support, the role she plays on the Rift is focused on being a savior not on scaring others. In my post I didn't just selectively pick out a minority, I selectively rewrote over half of her lore.

To almost everybody she is seen as the type of character a warmer, fuzzier version supports. Out of the rift both other champions and fans, inside the rift her teammates, she's well favored by all of Piltover. people like Janna, she has mood swings, but people picture Janna as the support you play when you have a carry that needs to be nurtured and protected. You don't play Janna because 'lol I want to blow stuff up'.

I never did address this, but Janna use to look more blue and menacing. Her new splash art shares quite a few similarities with her original. It should be noted, though that she was *the first champion to receive a visual update*. Her iconic splash art solidified her character, being gracious and beautiful, yet otherworldly.  Just because she is friendly, does not mean she is weak. Given the things she has been through, one could say it takes a lot more strength to smile.

The green you see is actually in the original work, is just more noticeable with out the glowing blue. I applied warmth to the entire picture, but [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/Osov1Wxd-janna-splash-color-tweaks-combining-ravencroft64-tehjacks-edits) someone took my suggestion and just applied it to Janna solely.

From her original work, to her first update and Chinese artwork, have her with a tattoo(or two) on her shoulder(s). I mention my thoughts about this [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/LG4c7jZK-i-figured-out-why-jannas-splash-art-makes-me-blue?comment=00070000).

I think the best value is something that's representative of her colors in-game, so probably something in between the two. A lot of Riot's more recent splashes has had a lot of dramatic, flavorful lighting, but it makes the portraits (especially the portraits) and splashes somewhat misrepresent the colors of the champion. it's one of those CLARITY! things Riot has been talking about.

I very much agree with this. Because of the color differences in her splash and icon from her character, I do not instantly recognize her, which is an issue of clarity.

There is  a lot with these new splashes that needs to be addressed(I still confuse Tristana's icon with Poppy almost every time I see it). I have mention these concerns elsewhere and have notice others having similar experiences.
